case_vignette: A 34-year-old man presents with an itchy rash, primarily on his arms, but also, to a lesser extent, on his face. He denies any fever or malaise, and his medical history is unremarkable. He does not take any medications and notes that he spent the previous weekend doing yardwork on his property, and the rash appeared 4 days later. Physical examination reveals several linear arrangements of papulovesicles on the dorsal and ventral aspects of his forearms with surrounding erythema.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash on my arms and a bit on my face.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
The rash appeared 4 days after doing yardwork last weekend.
Did you come into contact with any plants, substances, or insects during the yard work that may have caused the rash?
I'm not sure, I was just doing yardwork on my property.
Have you had any similar reactions in the past after yard work or exposure to plants?
My medical history is unremarkable, so no similar reactions in the past.
Do you have any known allergies?
I don't take any medications, so I guess I don't have known allergies.
Have you used any new skin care products or detergents recently?
No, I haven't used any new skin care products or detergents.
Does the rash have a specific pattern or shape, and are there any blisters or open sores?
The rash has several straight lines of small blisters on both sides of my forearms, and the skin around them is red.
Is the rash spreading or does it remain confined to the areas you've mentioned?
The rash is primarily on my arms, but there's a little bit on my face too.
Do any of your family members or close contacts have similar symptoms?
No, no one else has similar symptoms.
Is the rash painful or simply itchy?
The rash is itchy.
Final Diagnosis: Contact dermatitis likely due to poison ivy exposure.
